results.title: Un Sac de Billes = a Bag of Marbles
results.brief_description:
At the end of 1941, two jewish boys, Maurice, 13, and Joseph, 10, living in Paris are forced to wear a yellow star. This does not have much significance for them and they quickly swap them for a bag full of marbles. Chastised by their father, they learn about the surrounding dangers and are told they must leave their family to go and seek refuge in the ‘Free Zone’ with their two elder brothers. When the German Army invades the Zone, the children are arrested. In order to recover their freedom (and save their lives) the children must convince a priest to deliver them with a christening certificate.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Grunstein ; director, Jacques Doillon ; writers, Jacques Doillon, Denis Ferraris ; photography, Yves Lafaye ; music, Philippe Sarde.
Cast: Paul Eric Schulmann, Richard Constantini, Joseph Goldenberg, Reine Barteve, Michel Robin, Dominique Davros, Gilles Laurent, Gilles Laurent, Hubert Drac.

results.title: Un officier de police sans importance = A police officer without importance
results.creator_credit: Daniel Moosmann, Philippe Ogouz and Jean Larriaga
results.brief_description:
In order to help free his brother from jail, Pierre organises the kidnapping of a police officer to serve as hostage and bargaining chip.

Credits: Producer, Daniel Moosman, Philippe Ogouz ; director, Jean Larriaga ; writers, Jean Larriaga, Marc Porel ; photography, Roland Dantigny ; music, Laurent Petitgirard.
Cast: Marc Porel, Robert Hossein, Jean Negulesco, Dani, Charles Denner.

results.title: Un Milliard Dans Un Billard = a Million in a Billiard Table
results.brief_description:
In Switzerland, a bored bank teller and his inventor friend are planning a jewellery heist. Little do they know that a young American tourist they met earlier is also a jewel thief and planning to rob the same outlet.

Credits: Producer, Maurice Jacquin ; director, Nicolas Gessner ; writers, Nicolas Gessner, Charles Spaak ; photography, Claude lecomte ; music, Georges Garvarentz.
Cast: Jean Seberg, Claude Rich, Elsa Martinelli, Pierre Vernier, Jacques Morel.

results.title: Un Mauvais Fils = a Bad Son
results.brief_description:
Bruno returns to Paris after serving five years in an American prison for drug trafficking. Readjustment proves difficult as he searches for work, faces his working-class father who holds his past behaviour responsible for his mother’s death, and has an affair with another ex-addict, whose drug problems are not fully resolved. Awards: French Academy of Cinema (Cesar) 1980: Best supporting actor for Jacques Dufilho.

Credits: Producer, Alain Sarde ; director, Claude Sautet ; writers, Claude Sautet, Daniel Biasini, Jean-Paul Torok ; photography, Jean Boffety ; music, Philippe Sarde.
Cast: Patrick Dewaere, Yves Robert, Brigitte Fossey, Jacques Dufilho, Claire Maurier.

results.title: Un Jeune Couple = a Young Couple
results.brief_description:
Veronique is the impetuous party girl who falls for Gilles, a liberal-minded engineer with little ambition. The odd couple marries, but trouble begins, after the birth of their child. See also: ‘Sept jours ailleurs’ [X000417].

Credits: Producer, J. Loris ; director, Rene Gainville ; writer, Jean-Louis Curtis ; photography, Roger Fellous ; music, Jacques Lacome.
Cast: Anne Gael, Anny Duperey, Alain Libolt, Corinne Le Poulain, Jean-Francois Calve.

results.title: Un Jardin public
results.brief_description: In the Square Gambetta in Paris a little boy’s imagination brings a statue to life. There follows a transformation scene and in an imaginary park Marcel Marceau acts out in mime all the habitues of the park - the nursemaids, the young lovers, the policemen, and old men. His impersonations range from the faintly amusing to the maudlin, but Marceau’s many admirers will doubtless enjoy this film.

results.title: Un Innocent = an Innocent Man
results.brief_description:
Albert and Monique work in a plush hotel, respectively as night watchman and chambermaid. Monique is having an affair with Bob, the hotel barman. In order to finance their plan to elope to Biarritz and get rid of Albert, they set him up to burgle the room of one of the hotel guest. Albert is caught and the case is assigned to Judge Massot. During an interview with Judge Massot, Albert escapes and runs back home where he barricades himself with his children. As the police starts the siege of the house, Judge Massot decides to step in and talk Albert out of doing an even bigger mistake.

Credits: Producer, Jean Gauthier ; director, Nadine Trintigant ; writers, Patrick Modiano ; photography, William Lubtchansky ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Simone Signoret, Didier Haudepin, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Michel Vitold, Philippe Leotard, Juliet Berto, Etienne Chicot, Maurice Garrel, Pierre Vernier, Francois Perrot, Marie Trintignant.

results.title: Un Inconnu Nomme Eiffel
results.brief_description:
Gustave Eiffel was afraid that his famous tower would overshadow his other accomplishments. This short film sets out to shed light on a very prolific international engineering career which included the building of railway bridges, viaducts and the metal frame of the Statue of Liberty.

Credits: Director, Joan Laskoff ; photography, Jacques Mercanton ; music, Betty Willemetz.

results.title: Un Homme Qui Dort = a Man Who Sleeps
results.brief_description:
A student refuses to carry on with his studies and decides to live ‘in neutral time’ or at the limit of schizophrenia. Reference: Film Index International.

Credits: Director, Bernard Queysanne ; writers, Bernard Queysanne, Georges Perec ; photography, Bernard Zitzermann ; music, Philippe Drogoz, Eugenie Kuffler.
Cast: Jacques Spiesser, Ludmila Mikael.

results.title: Un Grand Patron
results.brief_description:
Doctor Delage is so dedicated to his work that he is out of tune with everything else, including wife, family and assistants. Through his encounter with a young orphan he is soon drawn to reassess his values and priorities in life and to rediscover is humanity.

Credits: Producer, Andre Paulve ; director, Yves Ciampi ; writers, Pierre Very, Yves Ciampi ; photography, Marcel Grignon ; Joseph Kosma.
Cast: Pierre Fresnay, Renee Devillers, Jean-Claude Pascal, Claire duhamel, Maurice Ronet, Claude Nicot.
